main event: A large, orange, glittery object resembling a perfect circle was observed over Oakland, California on May 1, 1931, and was noted to descend in size and brightness over a period of 3 minutes.
interesting points: The object was described as resembling a balloon,The observer saw the object for about 3 minutes,The object did not move in any direction during the observation,Report concluded the object was possibly unidentified,There were multiple pages of questionnaires and instructions for reporting sightings.
sighted object: a large orange object resembling a balloon
